website_summaries.verdict: Slim, small, and maneuverable, this Remington electric razor’s handy 5-minute quick charge mode makes this the perfect model for anyone with no time to spare.
cons: The 2 hour wait for this electric razor to recharge would be a bummer if it didn’t have a 5 minute quick-charge mode for a single shave

website_summaries.verdict: This is a quality electric razor that comes at an impressive price point. It’s powerful enough to even cut through long hair.
pros: Powerful razor that can cut through even thick facial hair
Long lasting battery and convenient battery level indicator light make this model a win
Handle shape makes it easy to grip
Grants a quality shave via the pivoting shaver head
cons: Razor is slightly noisy when in use

website_summaries.verdict: This cheap, versatile shaver doesn't sacrifice quality.
pros: This little shaver handles longer hair as well as it does stubble with its Intercept Technology
If you don't shave daily, this is a great option for that reason
A slightly longer charge time of two hours is compensated by how long this shaver holds a charge
cons: The foil is of low quality and may need to be replaced frequently

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY--Very Poor Quality Foil (No Warranty), Expensive to Replace on Ongoing Basis
customer_reviews.text: I strongly recommend NOT BUYING. Shaving foil is very poor quality, and you would be lucky to have it last longer than a few months. Remington's product warranty specifically excludes returns regarding shaving foil, likely because Remington is aware of this issue. Replacement foils are not cheap ($20), which if you're required to replace every few months defeats the point of having an electric razor. You should take the $80/year it will cost you for replacement foils and just buy a better quality electric shaver, but based on my experience here I would not recommend that being a Remington.
customer_reviews.author: Patti W.

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, but there is a reason
customer_reviews.text: I had read reviews about the shaver and noted that there was concern about the foil screen. I still bought the shaver, thinking that the issue may be a defect in those units. I have had the shaver for 4 months and while using it a couple of days ago felt pulling on my face and had several cuts on my face. I immediately checked the shaver and saw that the screen was "disintegrating." There were jagged pieces of the screen which had cut my face.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected after reading so many good reviews.
customer_reviews.text: This razor must have been defective from the factory or previously used. The first shave out of the box it literally pulled whiskers out of my face. The foil screeen is a $20 disposable piece of junk that will need to be replaced at least 3 times per year. I'm very disappointed in this shaver. I have been a loyal Amazon customer for several years but I wonder sometimes if they are allowing companies to sell seconds or repackaged goods.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Love It Even With Loose Screw
customer_reviews.text: A small screw (think glasses) attaching the swivel head to main body of the razor keeps loosening up. I've tightened once since it prevents attaching the foil screen after taking it off for cleaning, but quickly loosened again. Need to use some threadlock that will prob fix it. Aside from that I love it! I've been a wet shaver with razor for decades and have a couple sensitive spots on my neck. This electric shaver much more gentle on those areas.
customer_reviews.author: Rocloco

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing no match for Norelco
customer_reviews.text: I purchased Remington F5-5800 electric razor about six months ago. I have used it every day. The battery life is good and in the beginning it did seem to cut close but not now. Also it does not contain the cut whiskers in the shaver very well even after cleaning. The Remington was a replacement for a Norelco 3100. Today I got out the old (4years) Norelco razor. The older Norelco still cuts smoother, closer and no loose whiskers than the newer Remington. Cleaning either razor in no big deal. I should have purchased replacement blades for the Norelco.
customer_reviews.author: spokes

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS RAZOR!! Serious battery issues 60 days after purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this razor for my husband on January 23, 2020. It stopped working 2 months later. The battery indicates it is charged but when you turn it on for one second it lights up red and goes off. When my husband tried to charge it, the razor got VERY HOT and he had to unplug it because I was afraid it would blow up! Look for something else, you are throwing you money away if you purchase this product and you could possibly get hurt if the battery explodes. It was scary!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better shave and less expensive than Braun 7.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this two years ago. Used it for a few months, then decided to see what difference a higher-priced razor might make. Bought a Braun Series 7. After a few months of using the Braun and not being satisfied with it not shaving very close, brought out the cheaper Remington again --found that the Remington gives me a closer shave! Costs for replacement Braun 7 foil being absurd even if you can find them, I've decided to replace the foil of my Remington and just keep using it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Stopping charging after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is great...I shave twice a week, I've probably only charged this thing 3 times over 5 months. Other thoughts, if your hair gets any longer than stubble it takes several passes before it'll catch and shave all the hairs. Other than that it worked pretty well while it worked - no pulling or irritation. But like the title says...it won't charge anymore. Either the charger itself or the battery is bad but since it doesn't look like you can buy a replacement charger...I guess they're both going in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hsieh

customer_reviews.title: Broke mid shave
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband, it arrived on time, fully charged. He was shaving his head and half way through shaving, it fell apart. Granted it comes apart for cleaning but the black piece in the 2nd pic actually BROKE causing it to fall apart mid shave. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanné B.

customer_reviews.title: Very Close And Comfortable Shave.
customer_reviews.text: According to Amazon, I bought this in 2014, and I am now buying my third one. This is the razor I will use until I die of old age, if Remington keeps making it. I have always had neck bumps, starting with shaving in the Army long ago. I pretty much quit shaving my neck and just used a trimmer for it and shave the rest of my face. Once I bought the F5, I could finally shave my neck again. This shaver does not cause bumps, as long as I don't press too hard.. If you are looking for a great new razor, give this one a try.
customer_reviews.author: J. Trimble

customer_reviews.title: It Works
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 65-year-old black man who could never use an electric razor, it pulled the hair so bad I thought I would never try again. I was tired of shaving with razor blades, razor bumps are no joke, so I tried this electric razor. I shave every 3 days and I love it. charge and go now that I'm used to it I sit in the living room and shave. THIS WORKS
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: This is for pandemic shaving, but not everyday
customer_reviews.text: I’m 32 and only ever had 3 shavers; this one included. The first two were the same. One given to me when I was 18 and the other I purchased when I was 28. I shave almost everyday and replace the head every 4-6 months. I was at the tail end of my old, BIG NAME EXPENSIVE shaver and decided to buy a new shaver that was cheaper than the replacement head on my old shaver. Let’s just say, you get what you pay for. It doesn’t shave very well in my opinion, even for a $45 shaver. Save a bit more and go with something that’ll last you just as I have. I returned this FYI
customer_reviews.author: Andy D

customer_reviews.title: Worst shave of my life
customer_reviews.text: Personally, I believe this to be a waste of money. I've had better shaves from $2 disposables. It's inefficient, inaccurate, and a waste of time. The shave isn't that close, and you have to rub the same area again and again and again. Tried it with long hair, total bust, figured alright that's understandable. Buzzed the hair short, very short. Stubble length. Tried again with this, it sucks. Very patchy. Tried it dry, tried it wet, tried it with both thick and thin creams. It just sucks. Better yet, it actually caught my skin and gave it a good rip.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Failed in less than 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: My previous version lasted from 2011 until September 2017 (6 years). Unfortunately, this version has failed to work as of Nov 20, 2017. Less than 2 months of functioning. Never fell, never fipped in or submerged in water, ot just got weaker and weaker, then died.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Julien

customer_reviews.title: Very comfrotable
customer_reviews.text: This shaver is the most comfortable shaver I have ever owned. It never pulls whiskers or irritates my skin, even without using a pre-shave or washing my face first. I would rate it 5 stars in every category (battery life, noise, cleaning ease, comfort, etc.) except one, shave closeness. It does a good job, but not great. I'd give it a 4 for closeness. So I rated it 4 stars overall.
customer_reviews.author: J.D. Salinger

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: cuts very close but does not sratch or bother at all, leaves skin nice a smooth. i use a few times a week and only have to charge it every 2-3 months maybe even less. very easy clean top comes right off and you can litteraly just wash it in your sink and put the top on. i think its affordable because thay saved money on the handle materials but it shave very well and has a decent grip and feel. if you want to save money without comprising a good shave this is what youd be looking for
customer_reviews.author: Shaul strait

customer_reviews.title: SLOW!!
customer_reviews.text: I read that foil electrics were better than the Norelco style electrics but I now disagree. My old cheap Norelco gave me a much better shave that this foil electric and I am very unhappy with this product. I would return it but it is too later. My Norelco 4100 was a much better choice and I could get a close shave in about 1/3 of the time it takes me to get a mediocre shave from this overhyped electric.
customer_reviews.author: Howard

customer_reviews.title: Fragile shaving foils, but overall a god shaver
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good shaver, although it takes a couple minutes to completely shave off the 24-hour old facial hair. One positive is it's very easy to clean. After I had the shaver for two months, it already had developed two noticeable holes in the shaving foil which contacts the skin. Those holes would undoubtedly grow over time, and it would just a few more months before the holes become so large I could not use the shaver. When I contacted them via their website, Remington immediately mailed me a new shaver head at no cost. They informed me the foil is indeed fragile, so care must be taken, including not pressing the shaver too hard against your face.
customer_reviews.author: OnTheEdge

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I am shocked how well this thing works for the price. I have a fast growing beard and I only shave once per week. With this I can go from beard to clean shaven pretty quickly and easily. I was using an expensive triple head rotary type for years, wrongly thinking that technology was better. I had to finish up with an old bic because the rotary couldn't shave my neck well, and couldn't get in under my nose well either. This does both well. The flip out trimmer on this guy works so well there is barely any work left for the micro foil to do!
customer_reviews.author: J. Mullins

customer_reviews.title: rotary convert
customer_reviews.text: I used a rotary razor for many years and when you shave every day they work fine. Now that I'm retired I shave every 3 or maybe 4 days and the rotary pulls and hurts. I took a chance on a foil shaver and I'm glad I did. The F5-5800 works great even on long stubble and the battery lasts much longer than I thought it would. I can get 8 to 10 shaves before it needs charging. You can buy more expensive shavers but this one gets the job done for less than $50.
customer_reviews.author: lylelwr

customer_reviews.title: It Is Fine, But LOUD
customer_reviews.text: My husband wanted this so I ordered it for him. He likes it, but it is VERY LOUD. I always know when he is shaving because I can hear it all over the house. If noise doesn't bother you, then it should be fine. Remember I said it is LOUD.
customer_reviews.author: Gramx3

customer_reviews.title: Buy a Norelco
customer_reviews.text: Terrible experience with this razor. First, it's very noisy and does not provide as close a shave as my old Norelco. I like the visible battery life indicator, but that's about all I like about it. More difficult to clean and in the process of reassembling the razor after cleaning with water only, the thin screen separating protecting the blades somehow got a small tear. I didn't notice it until the tear cut my face in multiple places when trying to shave. The tear can't be fixed and the next stop before ordering a reliable Norelco was the garbage can where this razor belongs. Don't buy it!!
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: Great razor for the money
customer_reviews.text: The packaging was correct. It does shave closer than a Braun, which is the kind of razor I replaced. The Braun model was of similar design. And yes, it had seen better days, but it still functioned like day one even after three replacement heads. The battery was beginning to give out, thus in comes this razor. It does not come with a case. The razor is very comfortable to hold and it shaves very close. (At least with my beard, which is rather coarse.) For the money I love it and don't see why I should spend more.
customer_reviews.author: B. TABOR

customer_reviews.title: Very close comfortable shave
customer_reviews.text: As my beard has grown coarser, my rotary was no longer able to shave skin-close. This foil shaver does so without pulling or pinching, so that is good. The battery requires charging more often than I would like, and I'm not crazy about having to buy new foils every six months - but for the price, I can't complain. It does the job my old shaver, even with new cutting blades, would not do.
customer_reviews.author: ayespy

customer_reviews.title: Bulky.  Not Smooth.
customer_reviews.text: This Remington in fact it is same as I bought years ago I hoped they had improved. I fund it bulky, not at all smooth and unnecessarily heavy. I wish they would go back to the one foil compact powerful Remington in days of old. If you wish a good travel razor or even at home I recommend the Panasonic Electric Travel Shaver as it is smooth, much easier to maneuver and much less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Ron, Williamsbufg

customer_reviews.title: This razor works for ladies too!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a woman who bought this razor after being unhappy with my women's electric razor and not seeing great reviews on other razors made for women. I am so happy I bought this. This razor is awesome and give me a super close shave on my legs that my old electric razor never did. It also works well on the bikini area. My only complaint it with my armpits. It doesn't do a good job getting all the stubble and leaves my underarm feeling raw. So I will stick with my old razor for that, but definitely awesome for shaving your legs!
customer_reviews.author: Beth G.

customer_reviews.title: Older model better
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Remington shavers since 1958. Most of them have given a good shave and held up very well. I bought this one just because I felt that my model F7790 would someday stop working. It hasn't stopped giving a good, close shave and still holds a charge for a lot of shaves. But the F5-5800 still doesn't give as close a shave and the battery runs down to red (on which it works for about a week, but not as well). I know about letting the charge run down 5 times and not expecting a close shave for the first two weeks, but that hasn't made a difference
customer_reviews.author: Timeout

customer_reviews.title: Excellent all-around razor for the money
customer_reviews.text: I've used Remington electric razors for years, most recently a model with three foils at the top. Well, now all the models have a two foil-one cutter design. This F5-5800 gives a good overall shave. I was skeptical of the cutter on top between the foils, but it does a good job with the longer hair (such as on the lower neck) without requiring the pop-out trimmer. I also like that the plastic head fits better than before (easy cleaning). Overall, I don't think it shaves *quite* as close as my previous Remington used to. But, it is noticeably quieter, so I'll take the trade-off.
customer_reviews.author: Cobo 2112

customer_reviews.title: I bought 2 - one good battery and one bad
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shaver, used it for a couple months, and liked it, so I bought a second one for my summer cottage. The first shaver's battery was very good - still powerful motor after several shaves. However, the second shaver's battery was poor. After just one shave, the motor ran too slowly for a decent shave. These shavers may be last year's model, so some batteries may be old. Take your chances and return it if you get a bad one. The shaving quality of this shaver, though, is very good - better than the last Remington shaver I had and also much quieter than my previous Remington.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel D.

customer_reviews.title: Like taking a hedgehog to your face.
customer_reviews.text: If you have a couple of days growth this shaver is like take a hedgehog to your face. Unless you spend considerable time going over the same spots, particularly your neck and chin you’ll never look clean shaven. I just purchased a Norelco 3500 rotary for $15 more than this junk and it’s like night and day. Do yourself a favor—get that one and avoid this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: I had to pay $50 bucks for this shaver, but I'm not complaining. It works okay and that's with me having light whiskers. If I had a heavy beard, this probably would have been shipped back because it would get a close shave. You need to clean it after each shave to keep the blades sharp which can be time consuming. I just wished I could have gotten it cheaper! The charge lasts very long which is a positive thing! There's better shavers out there, but you're going to pay a lot more for it as well. NavyBoy
customer_reviews.author: Navy Boy

customer_reviews.title: Wrong impression.
customer_reviews.text: I think most of the reviews about this item are "fake news"! I received this item about a week ago and when i first used it in the morning after shower, oh OMG! It was very, very noisy! Neighbors next door complained that I woke them up with that loud noise! It does not shave "as the guy on the video says either" I guess I received what i paid for. Cheap price, cheap quality.
customer_reviews.author: Emilio Correa

customer_reviews.title: Get the job done, but it is sloooooooow.
customer_reviews.text: It is what it is . . . a cheap rechargeable razor. I've had it about 3 years. It still works, but I'm going to replace it since the 3rd screen went out on it. It lasts me 5 days on a charge. It does recharge quick, which is a positive. I have probably had 6 to 8 electric razors in my life and this one by far is the slowest of the bunch. Previous razors could complete a shave in 3 to 5 minutes. This thing takes me 10 to 12. It just cuts extremely slow. I would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Schram

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: My old shaver -- a Norelco rotary type -- was getting tired after 15 or so years and I decided to try this foil shaver. I remember my dad used a much earlier version. Now I need to shave every day -- this razor just doesn't cut very close. When I use a manual razor w. blades I only shave every third day, and with the Norelco it was maybe every other day. Now, I need to shave again in the evening if I want to looked decently groomed -- that would be twice a day! Otherwise, it's fine, works, easy to clean, battery lasts a long time between charges.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not shave
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed after getting this being a brand name it would work good for at least a year before having to replace the cutting blades. This razor is junk no good would not recommend this item for any one to buy. Remington has really went off the deep end of garbage. Very hard to empty and while curing or grinding mild one day stubble it all vibrates out and on to your counter top
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Good quality electric razor
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with everything about this razor (battery life, construction, easy to clean, etc). My only reason for 4 stars rather than 5 is the noise. This razor is louder than a few others I've used. It's not deafening, but it's enough to make you notice. I can live with the noise based on the performance of this unit and the price point.
customer_reviews.author: rsharp

customer_reviews.title: Used by a dementia patient.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 90 year old father who is recovering from Covid -19 and has developed dementia. He is no longer able to shave with a razor so we tried this razor. He loves it!
customer_reviews.author: tracy from pa

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for about 3 weeks now and have not needed to charge it yet. The shaver gets very close to your face almost no stubble and doesn’t hurt. You may need to go over a few spots a couple times but otherwise works great. For the price I would recommend buying it if you are unsure. I’ve owned many different electric razors and this is one of the best.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Works good. Feels well made.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Remington shavers for over 20 years. Every new model cycle the shaving heads get smaller, one might think that was the most expensive part of the shaver. I'd swear the very first one with a very large single head was the best but it's so long ago there isn't really anyway to compare. IAC, these new ones work pretty good. The design looks about the same as the Braun which costs three times as much. For the price I don't see how you can beat these.
customer_reviews.author: The Cat Family

customer_reviews.title: New not as good as old.
customer_reviews.text: I had a Remington f-5800 for 3 years. I was very happy with it, so when it came time for a new one, I went with the F5-5800. Not thrilled with it. Doesn't seem to shave as well as the last one. I spend more time shaving to get all the hairs. Also, every time I remove the screen, one of the blades falls out. Don't know if something is wrong with the blade or the shaver. Never had that happen with the old one. So I couldn't give this more than a 3 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Denopoulos

customer_reviews.title: Foil Assemblies Don't Last
customer_reviews.text: It gives a close and comfortable shave, however, the plastic piece that holds the foil in place fails to stay put after a few months of use, making it impossible to shave because this piece keeps popping off. Replacements are $25 each, so you have to spend $25 every few months for a new foil if you want to keep using it. After a year you've spent as much money as a new razor would cost. I am thus downgrading my rating to one star. My Wahl razor is more ruggedly constructed and does not have this problem.
customer_reviews.author: chris319

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Literally opened it out of the box and used it and it was amazing! Before I was using a old school razor blade the safety razor and this electric shaver gave me a closer shave plus it saved me alot of time shaving and it gave me a closer shave yet also smooth. Perfect for the price and it's hard to see any other shavers beating this for the price and the quality of the shave. If your hesiting just buy it and see for yourself. You cant go wrong on this product!
customer_reviews.author: Braxton

customer_reviews.title: Nice product! needs to fit better in hand
customer_reviews.text: My hubby has been using electric razor for many years and decided to try this one. He really likes the blade between 2 foils that gives you a very nice shave even if you missed a day of shaving, this is probably the best feature of this product. One disdvantage is that the battery is pretty big. It holds the charge for a really long time, but it makes the shaver feel big in your hand. Overrall I would recommend it and if ti was just a bit smaller on the handle, I would give it 5 stars, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Devon Dee

customer_reviews.title: Razor close shave!
customer_reviews.text: I get lazy shaving my neck and wanted to try an electric razor. It’s been about four days since I shaved my neck and this came today and I opened it immediately and it ran. Went to the bathroom and shaved my neck and it gave a great close shave and the edger was fantastic for shaping my beard and mustache. I’m very, very pleased with this razor and highly reccomend it for anyone too lazy to get some shaving cream and a manual razor. Great product seriously!
customer_reviews.author: TD

customer_reviews.title: A Value-For-Money Good Quality Electric Shaver
customer_reviews.text: May not be a fair review cause I was using a popular brand travel electric shaver before I got the Remington F5-5800. The Remington F5-5800 is certainly more powerful compared to my old shaver, heavier and louder. Have not tried wet shave yet, but the normal shave each morning was rather enjoyable. Just follow the instructions; gently glide over in small circular motion to get a nice smooth and close shave. The cutter assembly can be easily poped out for a quick rinse under running water together with the exposed blades. Rechageable battery allows cordless use. Been using for a week now and power LED indicator still reads full. I am very happy with my Remington F5-5800 electric shaver! :)
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Multiple complaints about this one...
customer_reviews.text: I bought it because Amazon recommended it. It's inexpensive and had decent reviews. After trying it for 2 months, I can confirm it's got multiple issues... - Razor tugs on my hair every time I use it - Razor head dislodges easily DURING use - Thing is super loud. Not a deal-breaker, but worth noting Unfortunately, I couldn't even return it as it got stolen by a maid at Great Wolf Lodge in Williamsburg. I hope the thief enjoys selling it for pennies...
customer_reviews.author: Peter Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great razor for shaving legs
customer_reviews.text: Have gone to an electric razor to shave my legs - have a Phillips rotary head razor that doesn’t do a good job, catches my skin. I did my research and chose this one - have been very happy with it - shaves close, doesn’t pinch or cut, and I don’t have to run over the same area multiple times to get all the hair. Great battery life, easy to clean, really like the battery indicator.
customer_reviews.author: Kaycee

customer_reviews.title: A godsend
customer_reviews.text: I've been searching high & low for an quality electric razor. I am a man of a certain ethnicity so my grooming needs differ; In particular in the shaving department. This shaver is is an godsend. It shaves very close minus all the negatives that come with dealing with an traditional shaver. I've yet to try a wet shave with it as I just recieved it, but I will be doing that next. Packaged & shipped out promptly. Arrived quickly. To the manufacturers of this product, thank you, & please dont compromise your products ever.
customer_reviews.author: DeAndre Adams

customer_reviews.title: Excellent razor
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my Remington Tri-Foil that I thought had finally lost it's battery - turns out it was the charging wire. I've used Remington shavers for over 50 years and they have all been very good. This razor has an excellent battery and gives a good comfortable and close shave, especially for the longer whiskers the Tri-Foil wouldn't cut. The only disappointment was the Tri-Foil gave a closer and somewhat more comfortable shave. but that is a very minor drawback. I highly recommend this razor.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Siegrist

customer_reviews.title: Quality shaver that will save you time
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used several different brands of shavers and this one is the best. I used to use one of those three round head shavers but they never would cut all the hairs and I felt like it took so long for me to shave my face. With this Remington shaver it shaved extremeley close to the skin without cutting you. I only need to shave about two times a week and takes me less than 5 minutes to get the job done each time.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Brink

customer_reviews.title: Works well but is very loud
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Remington F5-5800 over a month ago. It does well as a shaver. I purchased this shaver because it was time to replace the shaving head of my Braun Series 7, and this razor cost about the same as a replacement head for the Braun. One thing I noticed is that this razor is much louder than the Braun(probably because the Remington contains a lot more plastic). I also notice that the cutting blades vibrate at a slower speed than the Braun. Despite the differences this Remington does the job it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Will H.

customer_reviews.title: Foil doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: I received the razor mid August, the foil failed and caused a fairly deep cut on my head within the first month. I purchased a new foil, head and blade combination, and today (mid Oct) the foil again failed and caused another mile abrasion. Seems the foils only last 30-days and cost at least half what the initial razor did. I have an old cheap Braun that still has the same foil head and seems to provide a closer shave. If you purchase one of these, check the foil often, as the cuts can be fairly deep.
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: I'm writing this for the ladies! I use this ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm writing this for the ladies! I use this on my legs and omg talk about smooth! I have dark course hair on my Legs, and have never been able to find an electric razor that does not leave stubble. This razor actually leaves my legs completely smooth. It a quick shave and I use it everyday. It takes me about 5 to 10 minutes to completely shave from my knee down, it's perfection! The only downfall to this razor is it's a little louder than other ones I have tried. But I don't really care about noise, I care about smooth legs! So ladies, if you want baby butt soft smooth legs, this is the razor for you!
customer_reviews.author: Jillian

customer_reviews.title: No more hand razor blades replacement blades too expensive I'm set for about a year-and-a-half
customer_reviews.text: I like Remington products I had one before had it for about 5 years these new ones have lithium batteries in them though they last a lot longer and the charge last for like 20 days is the price of replaceable and hand razors replacement blades are ridiculously priced I won't have to buy any razor products for at least a year and a half I also picked up a replacement head for $11 the regularly $32 Amazon has some good deals I recommend them that's just me though
customer_reviews.author: Careful shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great Shave For The Price
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased with this Remington shaver as it provides a clean, close shave, especially if used daily and the charge lasts for weeks without needing recharging. My only gripe about this shaver it that stubble falls out from the hairpocket from between the two screens while shaving which can be inconvenient if you are shaving after you have dressed as you will have hair stubble down the front of your shirt. This is not the result of built up hair stubble in the hairpocket as I clean it out every time I use it, just a design flaw I guess. Other than that issue it is a fine product.
customer_reviews.author: T-Town Punk

customer_reviews.title: Whats wrong with people
customer_reviews.text: Ive had many electric razors in my life....I would never bother to review them because they are all mediocre...Ive had Panasonics Brauns Norelco's even a few brands I cant recall...This inexpensive shaver gives me the best shave by far...Do yourself a favor...Dont pay attention to the people selling you more expensive stuff....This Remington has so far exceeded my expectations I bought a second one. Maybe not the best travel shaver just because its slightly heavier than some ...but if its a decent shave you are after, save your money and by this shaver
customer_reviews.author: Joel Bluestein

customer_reviews.title: Excellent razor
customer_reviews.text: My husband LOVES this razor! It is his favorite electric razor he has ever used. He tried another razor with 3 circular blades but had to return it because it pulled on his facial hairs. This one works great, doesn't tug, and the battery lasts FOREVER. He has had this razor for almost a year and has literally only had to charge it ONCE!!! It provides a close shave and you can't beat the price either! I would definitely recommend this razor!
customer_reviews.author: Tori Timmons

customer_reviews.title: Finally got what I originally wanted
customer_reviews.text: I initially purchased a Braun thinking it was probably mfg better but was wrong. It lasted about 1 year with light duty (and it was the Shaver not the charger). I wanted to purchase the Remington originally but some commenters caused me to buy the Braun. I love my Remington. I have a beard and it goes right up to the beard line with no issues or pulls. It give me a very close shave with No Irritation, burn or pinching. Love This Shaver !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Reno

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Battery Life is about a week between charging for me. Removing foil head for can be tricky until you get the hang of it. (release one side at a time) This shaver is large so travel room may be an issue. Good value for the price it is offered..
customer_reviews.author: Boatbulider

customer_reviews.title: 2.5 Years and still love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this razor because of the flip-up clipper. It's like a hot knife through butter when my whiskers get too long and then the foil part uptop gets the job done. You just gotta go over the same area a couple times but this mother-lover keeps on truckin. For $40 range, I don't think it can be beat. NOTE: have changed the foil and internal blades once, like a year ago for like $25. Not sure if I needed to. Perhaps was just being busy.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Kilcoyne

customer_reviews.title: Defective battery/Returned to Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Good shave. Lousy battery. One blade popped off when I (carefully) removed the foil head for cleaning. Plastic construction throughout. There used to be some metal in an electric shaver, apparently not anymore. I'm back in the market for a quality, well built and reliable shaver. I have been a Remington customer/user since the mid 1980's, so this one is pretty disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Bob E.Top Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: this one is the best yet.
customer_reviews.text: i have been a remington user for 60 years, this one is the best yet.
customer_reviews.author: William Raulin

customer_reviews.title: Great razor
customer_reviews.text: I like the style of razor molesting got stolen luckily I was able to find this newer version of it. It will pull hairs now and then which is painful but I've sensitive skin in this seems to keep me from getting a rash. I had my last one for about seven years before it got stolen
customer_reviews.author: ZachMac

customer_reviews.title: Great razor especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: This razor cost about as much as a replacement head for a Braun razor. Also, even with new heads/cutters on my old Braun, this razor shaves much better. And, I think it shaves as well as the Braun did when new. This razor is a great deal, ergonomic and easy to clean. If they still make this when this razor stops working, I'll certainly buy another one. This was a very pleasant surprise.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Linn

customer_reviews.title: Enjoying This Shaver
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shaver because I wanted to stop using plastic disposable razors. I have sensitive skin and a tough thick beard that electric razors could never shave well so I've been shaving, with a blade, every other day to keep the skin rash under control. This shaver is easy on the face and shaves my beard as close as a razor so now I can shave everyday without skin issues. It cleans easily and came with a fully charged battery so I could start using it immediately. Although not small it is compact enough to travel with. Great shaver and the discount at checkout was a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Breeze

customer_reviews.title: Pitiful and ineffective
customer_reviews.text: I've had this same model of electric razor for nearly 8 years now and decided to grab a new one. Remington appears to have downgraded the motor inside this razor. It is extremely weak. A shave used to take me about 5 minutes - with this one, it took over 15 minutes because it literally doesn't trim hairs after many, many passes with the razor. And the trimmer is arguably less effective than the foil razor. What good is this object? I ended up having to use my girlfriend's leg razor. I'm disappointed with this product. I was going to return it, but felt weird about sending a used razor back.
customer_reviews.author: C.L.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shaver, poor directions.
customer_reviews.text: This shaver is much-improved version over the old one I had. It has a fast charging and long-lasting battery, easier to clean head and a trimmer built-in to the head that cuts longer hairs often pulled by the older version. It can also be used with cord or cordless. The accompanying pamphlet is somewhat confusing because it covers several models and fails to identify clearly which model has the features described; nor does it adequately elucidate how to implement the respective features precisely.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S Bajorek

customer_reviews.title: For that it's terrible. It takes forever
customer_reviews.text: My only real use is for pre-shaving my head before using a razor. For that it's terrible. It takes forever, compared to rotary shaver I used to use, doesn't get most of the hair, and it sheds everything that it does cut, so I have to stand in the tub. I would definitely not recommend it for someone using it on the head. I don't know why someone would answer that it works for heads. I'm buying a different shaver and hate this one.
customer_reviews.author: Grant Parks

customer_reviews.title: Excellent razor, ex
customer_reviews.text: I really like this electric razor, especially compared to my last one. Love the little pop up trimmer, battery lasts very well, and it gives a close shave. The very first time i used it i barely got any irritation and i was only using the pop up trimmer on my previous razor because the regular one tore my face up. Was very pleased with this one. Easy to clean also.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shaver; great value
customer_reviews.text: I've been shaving for 57 years and I've tried virtually every brand and style of electric shaver possible. I bought an earlier model of this Remington shaver about 8 years ago and it was terrific. Finally, it just wouldn't hold a charge anymore and I had to face the task of replacing it. I checked ratings of almost everything on the market and found this successor at an astonishingly reasonable price, so I ordered it. It's fantastic. Smooth, close shave. Quiet. Lightweight and easy to handle. I can't imagine there's a better value on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E. Little

customer_reviews.title: It works mediocre and is very loud
customer_reviews.text: It works just OK. Same as all my other $40 razors I guess but the thing is very loud. My sleeping wife said to me, "you need to decide, me or the razor". I'm shaving in the closet with the door closed until I can replace my wife. Other than that, I find the cleaning compartment awkward to access. That's not a deal breaker but overall, I'm not a fan of this razer.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon T. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Good for face, bad for neck
customer_reviews.text: If this shaved my neck like it shaves my face, it would be an easy 5 stars. Unfortunately, it misses half the hairs on my neck. My face gets a nice smooth shave in about 2 minutes, but even after 15 minutes of approaching from every angle and pulling and pushing my skin, there are still patches and rogue hairs on my neck. On the plus side, it doesn't irritate my skin so I have continued to use it; but it makes me miss regular shaving. I wouldn't buy this shaver again.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight rechargeable foil razor
customer_reviews.text: I am using this model to replace a Remington Titanium series foil head razor. The older model is still running using a cord but its battery pack died years ago. This model seems to do a better job at trimming off neck whiskers thanks to its foil head design. The fact that it has a 120/240 volt operation is a big advantage with traveling abroad. I am looking forward to a long service life from this unit.
customer_reviews.author: T. Miller

customer_reviews.title: The best electric shaver I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: After three months of using this shaver once a day, I can say that it is the best electric shaver I have ever used, and I have used a few Norelco's and Braun's in my life. It easily shaves so close with very light pressure that after shaving, my face feels as smooth as the proverbial "baby's bottom." I now look forward to shaving every morning, not dreading it as before. I used to get pulled hairs, missed hairs, and red bumps popping up here and there with my previous electric shavers, but after using the Remington I get none of these anymore, and with the closest shaves ever. It was an excellent choice, and for a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Frank D

customer_reviews.title: What a pleasant surprise...
customer_reviews.text: It's been years since I had an electric shaver. I am very surprised that a $40 dollar electric shaver did such a good job. No shaver burn. A very nice smooth close shave...quick too. For $40 bucks, you can't go wrong with this shaver. I am a fan...especially since the price of razors is through the roof. This is the best blade combo for me. Two microscreens combined with the shear/clipper in the middle to get the long stragglers. Dad used to work for Remington a long time ago...I used to get shavers free. None shaved as good as this.
customer_reviews.author: Yep

customer_reviews.title: and liked this shaver very much at first
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shaver due to the positive reviews, and liked this shaver very much at first. It shaved well and had a long battery life. But about 2-3 months after purchasing it, the head became a bit loose which made the shaver much noisier and harder to use. In the months that followed, the problem only became worse - and this week, there is a sharp piece of metal from one of the springs protruding from the bottom of the shaving head. The build quality, for me, definitely leaves something to be desired. It's a shame, because I was excited not to have to spend $100+ to get a decent shaver.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua J. Shron

customer_reviews.title: Wow this is a killer deal and it works really well.
customer_reviews.text: Wow! what a deal. I'd been looking for a replacement for my Braun for sometime now but couldn't find anything under $100 that I liked. Came across this and liked the reviews so I picked one up. I was skeptical, mostly because my wife says my glass is half empty, but this thing works great!! It is a little on the large size. The charge lasted over a week of everyday sue and recharged really quickly. The sideburn trimmer is a little awkward but it does work. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Tool Nut

customer_reviews.title: My battery is bad?
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if its just mine or I just got a bad battery or something, but the 24+ hour charge thing only gave me 40% mark. I unplug and plugged it in again started charging faster, I waited till 100%.....well I thought it was good now but it just instantly goes to the red after pushing the button.
customer_reviews.author: loltonytony

customer_reviews.title: A winner. A clean shave every time!
customer_reviews.text: I have used a number of different electric shavers over many years. Because of its better quality shaving results I have been using Remington Remington has the "edge" in this market. I have a particularly difficult beard to shave, yet my shaver performs admirably. It is a winner. I recommend it. Chef Taurus
customer_reviews.author: Taurus

customer_reviews.title: Great Shaver
customer_reviews.text: Having used a popular brand rotary shaver since I started shaving many, many years ago and never having used a foil type shaver, I was surprised how much closer this shaver shaves. This Remington shaver is extremely well made. It charges very quickly and the charge lasts much longer than my previous rotary shaver. Great electric razor.
customer_reviews.author: AD-BD

customer_reviews.title: Loud & shave not close
customer_reviews.text: I cannot get a close shave with this razor. I tried pulling the skin tight and going in circular motions like they recommend. It is also pretty loud. I have an old Remington MS2 390 Razor that is about 6-8 years old (don’t remember exactly when I bought it). It gives a much closer shave than this new razor and the blades have never been changed in the old one. That speaks volumes. A lot of reviewers are stating that they get very close shave with this razor, but that is not the case for me.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy!!
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT buy. Performance is TERRIBLE. Durability is TERRIBLE. Will damage your face and not be a close shave. And you will probably get sent a used razor that was already returned and then sent to you in a clearly opened and reused package with a mostly cleaned machine with stray stubble hairs and skin particles. Risk of HIV or Hep-C or other dangerous diseases. Never again will I buy something like this off Amazon, spend the extra $$$$ and get it from a place you can see with your hands and eyes what you're buying.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Used once, getting a refund
customer_reviews.text: Brutal. I figured I'd try an electric after about 40 years with a blade. I'm not sure if all electrics are like this, but after shaving there were still patches of whiskers it didn't get. I went back over the patches, and they still didn't get removed. I didn't give a ranking to battery life, easy to clean, or for traveling because after 1 use I'll be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Danny D.

customer_reviews.title: This shaver is so noisy it should come with ear plugs
customer_reviews.text: This shaver is advertised as quieter than previously models. It is not only not quieter than previous models, it's much louder, so noisy that it should come with ear plugs. Also, the razor head does not easily come off, so its not easy to clean. I'm disappointed because I always use Remington shavers.
customer_reviews.author: sheldon s. toll

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing from Remington. Wahl is better
customer_reviews.text: Runs like a machine. The Wahl shavers cut closer, smoother, quieter. This has a large surface area and a strong motor so it get the job done when in a hurry. I’ve tried a few new electric razors this year. The Wahl product line seems better and more advanced. I was replacing an old Remington and none of their new products were as good. Seems like they need to update what they’re doing.
customer_reviews.author: AmaExplorer Vic1768

customer_reviews.title: Best Women's electriic shaver
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a women's sheer for my legs. I had one marketed for women and wasn't impressed. Then I read a Consumer Report article that said they do not even review women's electric shavers because they are so inferior to men's. It suggested buying a man's, which I did with this purchase. Good decision...no going back.
customer_reviews.author: R. Fehrenbach

customer_reviews.title: Great shave
customer_reviews.text: My husband said this is the best razor he has ever had. He did not complain about the battery life or having to clean the razor and so I would assume..all going great!
customer_reviews.author: weight watcher

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work as well as many reviews I read
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Braun series 3. I read reviews of this razor and they were very good. However, I'm not happy with the quality of the shave. From what I can gather now looking at other Amazon reviews, it appears that many people say it shaves longer hairs well and very short whiskers poorly. This is my problem. My facial hair doesn't grow that fast but when I use this I have to go over the same spot again and again. This is not the right razor for me. I wish I could send it back. I would just go back to the Braun series 3
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Bedtelyon

customer_reviews.title: Closer shave
customer_reviews.text: Better than 3 head razors..overall 5 stars! A lot to choose from but I went with Amazon’s recommendation and I’m glad I did. Price is right and it’s a solid product. I don’t use the sideburn trimmer so I cant speak on that (looks kinda cheap) and being a foil razor some areas are more difficult to reach. But that’s really the only negative thing I can say.
customer_reviews.author: carmen wray

customer_reviews.title: Nice shaver, but battery is NOT replaceable
customer_reviews.text: I've had a rotary shaver most of my life, for the past 30 years. I switched to this foil shaver and it is much less irritating to my face. Only reason why it's 4 and not 5 stars is because the rechargeable battery is sealed & soldered inside. So once it goes bad, no more cordless option on this shaver.
customer_reviews.author: The Chem Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great shaver at a great value... on par with higher priced models
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a Christmas present for my hubby, he loved it, nice close clean shave which is required for his profession. Very affordable also, I have paid 3 x more and higher for other shavers & he says this one works just as well as the others. Most last him several years, this is the least expensive purchased so far... at this value if it lasts 2 years or more I consider it money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: DawnTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I normally like the razor but since my heart surgery and had ...
customer_reviews.text: I was surprise I have not used a electric shaver in almost 40 years when I was a young cadet at the academy. I normally like the razor but since my heart surgery and had to be on blood thinner I was not able to use the razor and had to go to an electric razor and I bought this one on reviews from other. It works great and gives me just as close of a shave as the triple bladed razors
customer_reviews.author: William Seymore

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was an experiment to see if I preferred the electric razor v shaving with conventional razor and shave gel. I was pleasantly surprised that it performed so well. Though I don’t get quite as close of a shave, it cuts closer that I expected and is much easier and more convenient than a razor and gel. I would definitely recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Ross

customer_reviews.title: Great Basic Razor!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best electric razors I have ever had! It works on my head and face and shaves as close as my old Braun razor. Battery life is great. My wife dropped it, and all I had to do is snap the razors and foil back on. Worked great even after that! I've had it 5 weeks and have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: CptProton

customer_reviews.title: there is no better electric razor
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd Remington foil razor I've owned in 30 years of shaving. For the money, there is no better electric razor. The first one I owned lasted about 25 years. Then I went with a different type of Remington shaver (the kind with 3 circular blades), now I'm back to the foil head...and couldn't be happier. The head pivots, making the shaving process smooth and easy. The blades shave evenly and don't yank the hair out like my 3 blade razor did. I wouldn't hesitate to purchase again. It makes shaving a pleasure.
customer_reviews.author: Allen H

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality but the price is raising up every time I buy one in less than 6 months..
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent machine. It feels great and do the job incredibly. The problem is the raising price. The 1st one I bought was around $35... In a travel I lost it, so I had to buy another one. The price? $ 45... I had to travel to see my Dad and I gave it to him because it is a great machine. I came to buy another one and it is @$60... If the price don't bother you, go ahead, Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Camacho

customer_reviews.title: foils wore out after two weeks
customer_reviews.text: Didn't pay attention to reviews before buying. But because my husband had a remington previously and bought for him for fathers day, it's what two weeks later. He was almost cut from crappy foils! Omg two weeks? Hopefully sending this back for a return. Insane. His prior remington lasted years! I came back in and read reviews from others, same foil issues after short use. This is consumer robbery, not ok. :(
customer_reviews.author: Emily Tran

customer_reviews.title: it's a shaver and puzzle in 1/
customer_reviews.text: The shave is 2nd to none, with that said, everything within the cutter area is cheap in terms of how well it's made. 1 and 2nd cleaning of the foil etc. it all fell apart, like a puzzle. I'm disabled and I don't want and shouldn't have to deal with that, who would? I will be returning this shaver due to that, regardless of the awesome job it does.
customer_reviews.author: Gianluca. Basile

customer_reviews.title: Best most effective Remington yet
customer_reviews.text: This is the best Remington I've owned (3 others over last 30 years). Close shave, pivoting head keeps it close to facial contours, battery life lasts a week or more, easy to charge, easy to clean, trimmer for sideburns, and a great price (Amazon). Totally pleased with this one, and highly recommend it. I also have (and use occasionally) a more expensive Remington, but this one is my shaver of choice. I've also tried rotary models (from other manufacturers), but they don't come close to the effectiveness and efficiency of this shaver. I just hope that whenever this one wears out, and I guess one day it will, they will still have this model available!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great for the value
customer_reviews.text: Great shaver for the money. I use this to cut the longer beards then use my Brain foil shaver for a closer shave; the Braun does not handle longer stubble well, so this combo works well for me. Can’t say this is as good as the more expensive models but it is greater at this price for what I need!
customer_reviews.author: amazonuser513

product_meta.title: Remington F5-5800 Foil Shaver, Men's Electric Razor, Electric Shaver, Black
product_meta.description: Shave close with the REMINGTON F5 Foil Shaver with Intercept Shaving Technology. The 3 stage cutting system uses the intercept tool for pre-trimming longer hairs and two flexible foils for close shaving. Plus, you’ll get up to 20 days of shaving between charges with the rechargeable battery that delivers 60 minutes of cordless runtime. The Remington F5 combines power and technology for a great shaving experience.
feature_bullets: Intercept Shaving Technology Pre trims longer hairs
Pivot and Flex Foil Technology Stays close to skin for smooth results
Rechargeable Battery 60 minutes of cordless runtime
Pop up Detail Trimmer For finishing touches on your facial hair and sideburns
Easy to Clean Washable under the faucet; Charging time 2 hours ; Voltage : Worldwide

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
